title: Enhanced thermotolerance via 22-nt small RNA-mediated silencing of SMXL4 and SMXL5
content: Small RNAs are crucial regulators involved in various biological processes. Among them, 21-, 22-, and 24-nt small interfering RNAs (siRNAs) can all trigger gene silencing (Sigman et al. 2021). However, the study of endogenous 22-nt siRNAs has been challenging due to their limited abundance. Researchers using Arabidopsis mutants defective in both cytoplasmic RNA decay and 21-nt siRNA production were able to observe an accumulation of 22-nt siRNAs (Wu et al. 2020). In a new study, Yajie Pan and colleagues (Pan et al. 2024) investigated the super-killer2 (ski2) dicer-like4 (dcl4) double mutant and found that 22-nt siRNAs enhance plant thermotolerance mainly by repressing SUPPRESSOR OF MAX2 1-LIKE4 (SMXL4) and SMXL5 genes.
